Container.Name: duplicati
Container.Overview: Duplicati(https://www.duplicati.com/) is a backup client that securely stores encrypted, incremental, compressed backups on local storage, cloud storage services and remote file servers. It works with standard protocols like FTP, SSH, WebDAV as well as popular services like Microsoft OneDrive, Amazon S3, Google Drive, box.com, Mega, B2, and many others.
Container.Changes:
### 2025-01-28 - Add xz-utils.
### 2024-12-03 - Add mscorefonts for captcha support.
### 2024-11-29 - Rebase to Noble, add support for settings DB encryption.
### 2023-02-15 - Rebase to Jammy.
### 2022-08-03 - Deprecate armhf.
### 2022-04-25 - Rebase to mono:focal.
### 2019-08-01 - Rebase to Linuxserver LTS mono version.
### 2019-07-16 - Allow for additional command line arguments in an environment variable.
### 2019-06-28 - Rebase to bionic.
### 2019-03-23 - Switching to new Base images, shift to arm32v7 tag.
### 2019-02-28 - Allow access from all hostnames, clarify info on image tags.
### 2019-01-13 - Use jq instead of awk in dockerfiles.
### 2019-01-11 - Multi-arch image.
### 2017-12-09 - Fix continuation lines.
### 2017-08-31 - Build only beta or release versions (thanks deasmi).
### 2017-04-24 - Initial release.

Config.Name: Path: /source
Config.Description: Path to source for files to backup.

Config.Name: SETTINGS_ENCRYPTION_KEY
Config.Description: Encryption key for settings database. Minimum 8 characters, alphanumeric.

Config.Name: CLI_ARGS
Config.Description: Optionally specify any CLI variables(https://duplicati.readthedocs.io/en/latest/07-other-command-line-utilities/) you want to launch the app with

Config.Name: DUPLICATI__WEBSERVICE_PASSWORD
Config.Description: Password for the webui. If left unset will default to `changeme` and can be changed from the webui settings.
